description: In his absence, a Navy young nurse struggles to reconcile her prejudices with her love for a secretive Frenchman named Emile and after she spends time with his children and comes to care for them, fears that Emile may not return alive.

title: Days of Glory
description: The film follows four North African men as they enlist in the French army to liberate that country from Nazi oppression during the Second World War and, controversially, fight with the discrimination against them.

title: When Trumpets Fade
description: Heroes are born when bullets fly, when the earth explodes, when cannons roar. Promoted against his will, a U.S. soldier (Ron Eldard) learns about survival, bravery and morality in World War II Germany.

title: Judgment at Nuremberg
description: The film centers on a military tribunal led by Chief Trial Judge Dan Haywood, before which four German judges who served on the bench during the Nazi regime face a military tribunal to answer charges of crimes against humanity for their involvement in atrocities committed under the Nazi regime.

title: A Woman in Berlin
description: Set in 1945 during the Red Army invasion of Berlin. Women are victims of rape and devastation; one of them is Anonyma, who had been a journalist and photographer. She resolves to control her fate and invites the attentions of a Russian major, Andreij Rybkin...

title: The War I Knew
description: On D-Day, Johnny drops with his British paratroop squad and is the only one to survive when they land off-target. Johnny soon comes across two other British soldiers, and a silent US Private. The four men band together, learning what it means to survive a harsh world, and yearn for the opportunity to leave this war and return home.

title: The Great Raid
description: In 1944, American forces were closing in on the Japanese-occupied Philippines. Over 500 American soldiers were being held in Cabanatuan, a notoriously brutal prisoner of war camp in the Philippines. And when they begin to give up hope they will ever be rescued, a group of Rangers goes on a dangerous mission to try and save them.

title: Sarah's Key
description: One of the darkest moments in French history occurred in 1942 Paris when French officials rounded up over 10,000 Jews and placed them in local camps. Julia Jarmond, an American journalist is commissioned to write an article about the event. She stumbles upon a family secret which will link her forever to the destiny of a young Jewish girl, Sarah.

title: Johnny Got His Gun
description: The film tells the story of blind, deaf, limbless, and mute Army soldier Joe Bonham who finds a unique way of communicating to his doctors his wish to be put on show as a true example of the horrors of war.

title: Voyage of the Damned
description: The story was inspired by true events concerning the fate of the MS St. Louis ocean liner carrying Jewish refugees from Germany to Cuba in 1939. The ship was eventually obliged to return to Germany, where certain death awaited its passengers.

title: The Men Who Stare at Goats
description: A reporter in Iraq gets the scoop of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.

title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
description: When British POWs build a vital railway bridge in enemy-occupied Burma, both British and American officers plot to blow up the structure. However, the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

title: Two Mules for Sister Sara
description: Sara is the hooker who poses as a nun in this tepid comedy. Stripped by bandits, Hogan is the heroic gunman who rescues her and is recruited to see her safely through the desert. The pair become good friends, but Sara never does tell him the true reason behind her being outlawed.

title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
description: SNL alumni Tina Fey steps into the well worn shoes of journalist Kim Barker in Paramount Pictures' adaptation of Barker's memoir The Taliban Shuffle: Strange Days in Afghanistan and Pakistan, which recounts her wartime coverage in Afghanistan.

title: Black Book
description: The film is about a young Jewish singer named Rachel Rosenthal (Carice van Houten) in the Netherlands who becomes a spy for the resistance during World War II after tragedy befalls her in an encounter with the Nazis.

title: Eye in the Sky
description: Col. Katherine Powell, a military officer in command of an operation to kill terrorists that are planning a suicide bombing in Kenya, sees her mission escalate when a preteen girl is selling bread just outside the targeted building.

title: Private Peaceful
description: The film tells the story of the unbreakable bond between two brothers during World War 1, from the innocence of their childhood in the fields of Devon to the pressures of their feudal family life, the war, and the price of courage and cowardice.

title: The Mark of Cain
description: The film follows three British young soldiers as they experience the extremity of war for the first time, and the permanent effects of what they have seen and done as they return from their tour of duty in Iraq.

title: Drone
description: The documentary follows people on both sides of the drone technology, uncovering crucial secrets of the CIA drone program, and shows how drones have changed war and possibly our future.

title: The Fear
description: The film follows Gabriel Dufour, a young conscript in the French army as he goes though World War I. Through the trials, horrors, and tribulations of war, he survives and discovers his own humanity.

title: The Killing Fields
description: The film follows New York Times reporter Schanberg, a journalist who covers some of the tragedy and madness of the war in Cambodia with the help of local interpreter Dith Pran Ngor, who is exiled to Cambodian labor camps where millions of others have died.
